snmp_h.intro_Txt: The Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) allows remote monitoring and management of network devices. An SNMP community is the group of devices and management station running SNMP. Community names are used to identify groups. The Axis product can be configured to support SNMP.
snmp_h.enable_Txt: Enable SNMP - select the version of SNMP to use by checking the appropriate box.
snmp_h.read_community_Txt1: Read community - Specify the community name that has read-only access to all supported SNMP objects.
snmp_h.write_community_Txt1: Write community - Specify the community name that has read/write access to all supported SNMP objects (except read-only objects).
snmp_h.traps_intro_Txt: Traps are used by the camera to send messages to a management system for important events or status changes. These settings are used with SNMP v1/v2c.
snmp_h.enable_Rraps_Txt: Enable traps - Check this box to activate trap reporting.
snmp_h.traps_addr_Txt: Trap address - Enter the IP address of the management server.
snmp_h.traps_addrNote_Txt: Note: The trap address field can not be used when SNMP v3 is enabled. When using SNMP v3, the trap address is set through the SNMP v3 management application.
snmp_h.traps_comm_Txt: Trap community - Community to use when sending a trap message to the management system.
snmp_h.traps_available_Txt2: Cold start - Sends a trap message when SNMP has started and the configuration as well as the MIB (Management Information Base) may have changed
snmp_h.traps_available_Txt3: Warm start - Sends a trap message when SNMP has started and the configure file has changed, but not the MIB.
snmp_h.traps_available_Txt4: Link up - Sends a trap message when a link changes from down to up
snmp_h.traps_available_Txt5: Authentication failed - Sends a trap message when an authentication attempt fails
snmp_h.mib_traps_Txt: Note: All AXIS Video MIB traps are enabled when you enable SNMP v1/v2c traps. For more information see
snmp_h.sNMPv3_intro_Txt: SNMP v3 is a more secure version providing encryption and secure passwords. To use SNMP v3, HTTPS must be activated. To use traps with SNMP v3 an SNMP v3 management application is needed.
snmp_h.sNMPv3_intro_Txt-1: SNMP v3 is a more secure version providing encryption and secure passwords. To use SNMP v3, HTTPS must be activated as password is sent over HTTPS to avoid unencrypted SNMP v1/v2c traps being accessed by unauthorized parties. SNMP v3 traps are setup through the protocol, that is, the settings in the SNMP management application.
snmp_h.enable3_Txt: Enable SNMP v3 - Check this option to activate SNMP v3. HTTPS must also be activated.
snmp_h.password_v3_Txt1: SNMP v3 Initial password - Enter the SNMP password here.
snmp_h.password_v3_Txt1-1: SNMP v3 Initial user's password - Enter the SNMP password here.
snmp_h.password_v3_Txt2: Note: The SNMP v3 password can only be set once, and only when HTTPS is enabled.
snmp_h.password_v3_Txt3: Once the password has been set, the password field will no longer be displayed. To set the password again, the product must be reset to the
